plants.idMarkers: Opposite, serrated leaves with stinging hairs. Square-ish stems and dense clusters of small green flowers.
plants.lookalikeWarning: Do not confuse with non‑stinging dead‑nettles (Lamium spp.) which have similar leaves but no stinging hairs.

recipe.prep: Blanch leaves 1–2 minutes to remove sting. Drain and squeeze dry.
recipe.simple: Nettle soup: sauté onion/garlic, add blanched leaves and stock, blend, season.
recipe.pairing: Garlic, lemon, potatoes, eggs, soft cheeses.

plants.idMarkers: Broad, lance‑shaped leaves with a strong garlic scent when crushed; white star‑shaped flowers in spring.
plants.lookalikeWarning: Can be confused with lily of the valley or autumn crocus, which are toxic and lack garlic smell.

recipe.prep: Wash and dry leaves. Use fresh; heat reduces flavor.
recipe.simple: Ramson pesto: blend leaves with olive oil, nuts, hard cheese, lemon, salt.
